tasks.task: Farmer discusses management strategies for pests in commercial strawberry production.
subtasks: Describing the life cycle and feeding habits of two-spotted spider mites, including their webbing and egg-laying.
Explaining the impact of sap beetles on overripe fruit and suggesting monitoring methods like bait buckets.
Discussing thrip damage and control options, including agricultural practices and insecticides.
Highlighting the emergence and significance of spotted wing drosophila (SWD) in strawberry crops, their reproductive method, and life cycle.
Presenting monitoring techniques for SWD using sticky red traps and discussing chemical control options, resistance management, and timings.
Detailing non-chemical control methods for SWD such as habitat modification, physical barriers, and sanitation practices.
Emphasizing the importance of pollinator health and providing resources for managing pesticide impacts.
Recommending the use of the Southeast Small Fruit Consortium Guide for integrated pest management in strawberries.
